data.title: Lagardère Travel Retail forms new UK & Ireland leadership team
data.meta_description: This strategic change highlights the retailer's commitment to strengthening its presence in the UK and Ireland and to delivering exceptional experiences to its customers and partners
data.text:
Lagardère Travel Retail has announced the formation of a new leadership team in the UK and Ireland markets to accelerate its growth plans and enhance its position as a leading travel retail operator.

Following the appointment of Peter Newbould as CEO for UK & Ireland, the new leadership team will drive business growth and support talent development within the organisation.

This strategic change highlights the retailer’s commitment to strengthening its presence in the UK and Ireland and to delivering exceptional experiences to its customers and partners.

The leadership team is as follows:

CEO, Peter Newbould: With more than 25 years of experience in retail and travel retail, including a decade in international leadership roles at WHSmith, Newbould has successfully served as Managing Director and Senior Vice President for the airport electronics and travel accessories brand InMotion, and moved to Harding+ as Chief Commercial Officer. Known for his visionary leadership and deep industry expertise, Peter will lead the Lagardère Travel Retail UK & Ireland.

F&B Director, Erika Baranscher: Baranscher graduated from the Hotel Management School in Hannover and brings over 25 years of experience in retail, contract catering, hotels, and restaurants. Prior to joining Lagardère Travel Retail in February 2024, she spent five years with Aramark and Avoca. Her innovative approach and passion for excellence will elevate our dining experiences in the UK & Ireland.

HR Director, Gail Downing: Downing has held several Senior HR Roles across multiple Industries and brands, including Matchesfashion, Pandora and HSBC. She holds an MBA and is a chartered Fellow of The Chartered Institute of Personnel & Development (FCIPD). Her strategic insights and commitment to fostering a positive workplace culture are invaluable assets.

Retail Director, Tim Ward: After significant experience at London City Airport for nine years and as retail manager at McArthurGlen Group, Ward joins the company to spearhead its retail operations, driving customer satisfaction and operational excellence.

IT Director, Etienne Leutenegger: Leutenegger joined Lagardère Travel Retail in 2008 at its Paris HQ and has accumulated over 15 years of experience in travel retail. He contributed to the expansion of the group, participating in the opening of various stores in countries like the Czech Republic, Spain, UK, and Ireland with concepts like Aelia Duty Free, Relay, Watermark, the Fashion Place, and Eye Love. In 2012, he became a part of the management team in the UK and Ireland.

Commercial Director, Liam Grundy: Grundy joined Lagardère Travel Retail UK & Ireland in 2022 after spending a decade with Manchester Airport Group in a variety of operational and commercial roles. During his time there, he contributed to the redevelopment of London Stansted Airport and played a key role in the growth of MAG USA. In this role, he successfully secured premium services such as lounges and commercial parking. His strategic expertise will be invaluable in shaping our commercial and growth strategies.
